meanings.definition: The action of making something narrower or tighter.
meanings.sent1: The coarctation of the belt made it difficult to breathe.
meanings.sent2: The coarctation of the road caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent3: The coarctation of the jar lid led to a comical struggle to open it.
meanings.sent4: Her strict coarctation of rules made it challenging for others to follow.
meanings.sent5: The coarctation of the riverbanks during the flood intensified the water flow.

meanings.definition: A congenital narrowing of a vessel or passage in the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the baby with a coarctation of the aorta.
meanings.sent2: The coarctation of the artery required surgical intervention.
meanings.sent3: The coarctation of the straw made it impossible to sip the drink.
meanings.sent4: His coarctation of interests limited his social interactions.
meanings.sent5: The coarctation of the tunnel entrance caused delays in traffic.
